title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: An old lady, named Greenhill, who with one servant occupied a cottage out at Mayfield, one night roused her maid with a terrific ringing of her bedroom bell, accompanied by a succession of shrieks loud enough to have awakened the Seven Sleepers. The girl, Bella Chisholm, was but a light sleeper, and the moment she heard that awful outcry she sprang up and hurried to the bedroom without taking time to dress.

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: I did not think that the new lover would be given to writing much, but decided to try. I went out to Mayfield and saw Bella, and rather surprised her by asking her to see the inside of her box again. She obeyed with the greatest readiness, and lifted out article after article till she came to her bank-book and two letters, which she showed me but kept in her hand—the hand trembling visibly as it had done before.

title: Memoirs, journal, and correspondence of Thomas Moore.
author: Moore, Thomas
snippet: I have taken my place, and shall start at five o'clock on Tuesday morning, and sleep away my weariness at Leicester. On Wednesday I shall proceed, and arrive to a late dish of tea at Mayfield. If you wish for a walk, and the sun shines, pray wander that way towards seven o'clock.
